title: Manmohan Singh - Wikipedia
snippet: Manmohan Singh (26 September 1932 – 26 December 2024) was an Indian economist and statesman who served as the prime minister of India from 2004 to 2014. He was the fourth longest-serving prime minister after Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi, and Narendra Modi.

title: Dr. Manmohan Singh | Prime Minister of India
snippet: From 1991 to 1996, Dr. Singh served as India’s Finance Minister, marking a turning point in the nation’s economic history. His role in ushering in a comprehensive policy of economic reforms remains globally celebrated.

title: Manmohan Singh | Biography, Reforms, Political Career, & Death | Britannica
snippet: Manmohan SinghAn economist by education, Manmohan Singh brought significant reforms to India as the country's finance minister during the 1990s, at a time when India was near economic collapse.

title: DR. MANMOHAN SINGH
snippet: However, Dr Manmohan Singh is known ... demeanor. He is a Prime Minister who will be remembered not only for the leaps and bounds by which he took India forward but also as a man of thought and of integrity....

title: The Legacy of Former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh | Asian LAW College
snippet: Singh’s tenure witnessed efforts to promote financial inclusion through initiatives like the launch of the Aadhar program, which aimed to provide a unique identity to residents and streamline access to government services and subsidies.
